item.title: Create and Manage services in Termux
item.description: In this post, I will show you how to create and manage services in Termux. Termux is an Android terminal emulator and Linux environment app that works directly with no rooting or setup required. Termux uses runit as its init system. “runit is a cross-platform Unix init scheme with service supervision, a replacement for sysvinit, and other init schemes.” pkg install termux-services Then restart Termux so that the service-daemon is started.

item.title: Little bit about Arch Linux
item.description: For most my life with computers I have used Linux. Windows was great but I decided to use Ubuntu. I tried out all sorts of Linux distros (ie. Elementary OS, Linux Mint, etc) but none of them seemed right for me. After doing some searching around and I came to the conclusion that I had to attempt to use a minimal linux distro that is Arch Linux.
